H0.text: Because of the way planets reflect light, the light year is often used to describe distances between objects in the universe.

H1.text: Because of the great number of bright stars is why the lightâ€‘year is often used to describe distances between objects in the universe.

H2.text: Because of the way objects rotate and revolve, the light year is often used to describe distances between objects in the universe.

H3.text: Because of the large distance between objects in space, the light year is often used to describe distances between objects in the universe.

A4.text: Distances expressed in light-years include those between stars in the same general area, such as those belonging to the same spiral arm or globular cluster.

A5.text: Galaxies themselves span from a few thousand to a few hundred thousand light-years in diameter, and are separated from neighbouring galaxies and galaxy clusters by millions of light-years.
